intro: Hieracium cheirifolium, commonly known as the Moroccan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Morocco. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. It produces yellow flowers with a distinctive central disc and surrounding ray florets. Hieracium cheirifolium is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
